cards.name: Sentinels of Glen Elendra
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
cards.flavor: Some say the valley of Glen Elendra is mythical, and that rumors of its existence are nothing but a faerie prank. Others say it is the fae's most fiercely guarded secret.
cards.originalText:
Flash
Flying

cards.name: Shapesharer
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{2}{U}: Target Shapeshifter becomes a copy of target creature until your next turn.
cards.flavor: One good mimic deserves another.

rulings.text: The copy effect doesn't wear off until just before your next untap step (even if an effect will cause that untap step to be skipped).

If Shapesharer itself becomes a copy of another creature, it loses both changeling and its activated ability (unless it's copying another creature with changeling and/or another Shapesharer, of course).
This ability can cause a creature to become a copy of itself. This will usually have no visible effect.

The targeted Shapeshifter copies the printed values of the targeted creature, plus any copy effects that have been applied to it. It won't copy counters on that creature. It won't copy effects that have changed the creature's power, toughness, types, color, and so on.
If the targeted Shapeshifter copies a creature that's copying a creature, it will become whatever the chosen creature is copying.

If the targeted Shapeshifter becomes a copy of a face-down creature, it will become a 2/2 creature with no name, creature type, abilities, mana cost, or color. It will not become face down and thus can't be turned face up.

Effects that have already applied to the targeted Shapeshifter will continue to apply to it. For example, if Giant Growth had given it +3/+3 earlier in the turn, then this ability makes it a copy of Grizzly Bears, it will be a 5/5 Grizzly Bears.
If either target becomes an illegal target, the ability will resolve but have no effect.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{2}{U}: Target Shapeshifter becomes a copy of target creature until your next turn.

cards.name: Silvergill Adept
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a Merfolk card from your hand or pay {3}.
When Silvergill Adept enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I bring baubles of lore, lost secrets seined from the listening waves."
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Silvergill Adept, reveal a Merfolk card from your hand or pay {3}.
When Silvergill Adept comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Silvergill Douser
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Merfolk and/or Faeries you control.
cards.flavor: The Silvergill school monitors traffic on the Lanes, ensuring that the riffraff don't interfere with travelers.

rulings.text: A permanent that's both a Merfolk and a Faerie is counted only once when determining X.
The value of X is determined when Silvergill Douser's ability resolves. It won't change later, even if the number of Merfolk and/or Faeries you control changes.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Merfolk and/or Faeries you control.

cards.name: Sower of Temptation
cards.text:
Flying
When Sower of Temptation enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature for as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: One glamer leads him far from home. The next washes away his memory that home was ever anywhere but at her side.

rulings.text: You retain control of the targeted creature as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield, even if a different player gains control of Sower of Temptation itself.
If Sower of Temptation leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will have no effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sower of Temptation comes into play, gain control of target creature as long as Sower of Temptation remains in play.

cards.name: Spellstutter Sprite
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Spellstutter Sprite enters the battlefield, counter target spell with converted mana cost X or less, where X is the number of Faeries you control.

rulings.text: The value of X needs to be determined both when the ability triggers (so you can choose a target) and again when the ability resolves (to check if that target is still legal). If the number of Faeries you control has decreased enough in that time to make the target illegal, Spellstutter Sprite's ability won't resolve (and the targeted spell will resolve as normal).

foreignNames.name: 呪文づまりのスプライト

cards.originalText:
Flash
Flying
When Spellstutter Sprite comes into play, counter target spell with converted mana cost X or less, where X is the number of Faeries you control.

cards.name: Stonybrook Angler
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor: "Water is in the air, the trees, and the earth. Understand its motion, speak its language, and the subtle currents that flow through all living things will fall under your command."
cards.originalText: {1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Streambed Aquitects
cards.text:
{T}: Target Merfolk creature gets +1/+1 and gains islandwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We look in the river and see scattered stones. A merrow looks and sees a map of Lorwyn."
—Illulia, flamekin soulstoke
cards.originalText:
{T}: Target Merfolk creature gets +1/+1 and gains islandwalk until end of turn.
{T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.

cards.name: Surgespanner
cards.text: Whenever Surgespanner becomes tapped, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: They ride on waves of Æther, washing out anything that might pollute the Merrow Lanes.

rulings.text: This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever Surgespanner becomes tapped, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Tideshaper Mystic
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: He paints with drop and shimmer a world that exists only in the wistful heart.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Turtleshell Changeling
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{U}: Switch Turtleshell Changeling's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A changeling involuntarily mimics the nearest being at hand, sometimes trading a borrowed shell for borrowed claws.

rulings.text: Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{1}{U}: Switch Turtleshell Changeling's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Wanderwine Prophets
cards.text:
Champion a Merfolk (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Merfolk you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Whenever Wanderwine Prophets deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice a Merfolk. If you do, take an extra turn after this one.

foreignNames.name: ワンダーワインの預言者

cards.originalText:
Champion a Merfolk (When this comes into play, sacrifice it unless you remove another Merfolk you control from the game. When this leaves play, that card returns to play.)
Whenever Wanderwine Prophets deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice a Merfolk. If you do, take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Whirlpool Whelm
cards.text: Clash with an opponent, then return target creature to its owner's hand. If you win, you may put that creature on top of its owner's library instead. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: You choose the target when you play Whirlpool Whelm, not when you clash.
If you don't win the clash, the targeted creature always goes to its owner's hand. If you win the clash, you choose whether the creature goes to its owner's hand or the top of its owner's library.

If you clash with the owner of the targeted creature and win, the owner of the creature decides where to put to card revealed during the clash before you decide whether to put the creature on top of that library. You know the player's decision before you make your decision.

cards.originalText: Clash with an opponent, then return target creature to its owner's hand. If you win, you may put that creature on top of its owner's library instead. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Wings of Velis Vel
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Until end of turn, target creature has base power and toughness 4/4, gains all creature types, and gains flying.
cards.flavor: Changeling magic grants unusual wishes.

rulings.text: Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

foreignNames.name: ヴェリズ・ヴェルの翼

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Target creature becomes 4/4, gains all creature types, and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Zephyr Net
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has defender and flying.
cards.flavor: Faeries hang beings that interest them as ornaments in the sky, each clique competing to outshine the prize of the last.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has defender and flying.

cards.name: Black Poplar Shaman
cards.text: {2}{B}: Regenerate target Treefolk.
cards.flavor: It absorbs the pain of other treefolk, which leaves it bitter, yet addicted to the sensation of agony.

foreignNames.name: 黒ポプラのシャーマン

cards.originalText: {2}{B}: Regenerate target Treefolk.

cards.name: Bog Hoodlums
cards.text:
Bog Hoodlums can't block.
When Bog Hoodlums enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Bog Hoodlums. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText:
Bog Hoodlums can't block.
When Bog Hoodlums comes into play, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Bog Hoodlums. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Boggart Birth Rite
cards.text: Return target Goblin card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Auntie excitedly held up the squalling newborn. "This one looks like Byoog! Maybe he'll tell us what he saw and felt in the beyond."

foreignNames.name: ボガートの誕生の儀式

cards.originalText: Return target Goblin card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Boggart Harbinger
cards.text: When Boggart Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
cards.originalText: When Boggart Harbinger comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

cards.name: Boggart Loggers
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{2}{B}, Sacrifice Boggart Loggers: Destroy target Treefolk or Forest.
cards.flavor: Auntie Flint lent axes to Nibb and Gyik, thinking they'd share their experiences with her. She's still waiting for them to come back.
cards.originalText:
Forestwalk
{2}{B}, Sacrifice Boggart Loggers: Destroy target Treefolk or Forest.

cards.name: Boggart Mob
cards.text:
Champion a Goblin (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Goblin you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Whenever a Goblin you control deals combat damage to a player, you may create a 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature token.
cards.originalText:
Champion a Goblin (When this comes into play, sacrifice it unless you remove another Goblin you control from the game. When this leaves play, that card returns to play.)
Whenever a Goblin you control deals combat damage to a player, you may put a 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature token into play.

cards.name: Cairn Wanderer
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
As long as a creature card with flying is in a graveyard, Cairn Wanderer has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, landwalk, lifelink, protection, reach, trample, shroud, and vigilance.

rulings.text: Cairn Wanderer's ability looks at all cards in all graveyards. It gains any landwalk abilities and any protection abilities.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
As long as a creature card with flying is in a graveyard, Cairn Wanderer has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, landwalk, lifelink, protection, reach, trample, shroud, and vigilance.

cards.name: Colfenor's Plans
cards.text:
When Colfenor's Plans enters the battlefield, exile the top seven cards of your library face down.
You may look at and play cards exiled with Colfenor's Plans.
Skip your draw step.
You can't cast more than one spell each turn.

rulings.text: The turn you cast Colfenor's Plans, you have cast (at least) one spell that turn. After it enters the battlefield and its last ability goes into effect, you can't cast any more spells that turn.
Playing a card exiled with Colfenor's Plans follows all the normal rules for playing that card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all timing restrictions, for example.
If an exiled card has morph, you may cast it face down.
If Colfenor's Plans leaves the battlefield, you can continue to look at cards exiled by it, but you can no longer play them.

foreignNames.name: コルフェノールの計画

cards.originalText:
When Colfenor's Plans comes into play, remove the top seven cards of your library from the game face down.
You may look at and play cards removed from the game with Colfenor's Plans.
Skip your draw step.
You can't play more than one spell each turn.

cards.name: Dread
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
When Dread is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

rulings.text: The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its new zone when its owner shuffles their library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

cards.originalText:
Fear
Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
When Dread is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.name: Dreamspoiler Witches
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: At night, the faeries steal dreamstuff for their queen. At daybreak, countless creatures wake weak and hollow.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Exiled Boggart
cards.text: When Exiled Boggart dies, discard a card.
cards.flavor: Among the boggarts, there is only one real rule: all new treasures and experiences must be shared. Those who hoard their gifts commit the one truly unforgivable sin.
cards.originalText: When Exiled Boggart is put into a graveyard from play, discard a card.

cards.name: Eyeblight's Ending
cards.text: Destroy target non-Elf creature.
cards.flavor:
"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana
cards.originalText: Destroy target non-Elf creature.

cards.name: Facevaulter
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Facevaulter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Boggarts get so excited when they find something new to smash that they really don't notice who gets underfoot.
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Facevaulter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Faerie Tauntings
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have each opponent lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: Beneath the fae's constant pranks runs a subtler undercurrent of mockery: the influence of Oona, their hidden queen.

rulings.text: You choose either to have each opponent lose 1 life or to have no opponent lose any life. You don't choose for each opponent individually.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have each opponent lose 1 life.

cards.name: Final Revels
cards.text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
• All creatures get -0/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: One whiff of the sweet, pungent scent leads to euphoria—or to an early grave.
cards.originalText: Choose one All creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn; or all creatures get -0/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fodder Launch
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a Goblin.
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn. Fodder Launch deals 5 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: Leave it to a boggart to come up with a projectile as disgusting as it is deadly.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Fodder Launch, sacrifice a Goblin.
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn. Fodder Launch deals 5 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Footbottom Feast
cards.text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The scent of rot and vinegar fills the marsh, inviting boggarts from every warren to reunite and feast.

rulings.text: You choose the order of the cards you put on top of your library.

You can cast this with zero targets. If you do, you'll get to draw a card. However, if you cast this with at least one target and all of those targets become illegal, the spell won't resolve and you won't get to draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Ghostly Changeling
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{1}{B}: Ghostly Changeling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In desolate places, changelings may take the shape of fancies, or memories, or fears.
cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{1}{B}: Ghostly Changeling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hoarder's Greed
cards.text: You lose 2 life and draw two cards, then clash with an opponent. If you win, repeat this process. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)

rulings.text: The effect will automatically repeat itself until its controller doesn't win the clash. There's no other way to stop it.

cards.originalText: You lose 2 life and draw two cards, then clash with an opponent. If you win, repeat this process. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Hornet Harasser
cards.text: When Hornet Harasser dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"And though she didn't get her honey, Auntie found something far more interesting."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

rulings.text: Hornet Harasser's ability is mandatory. If you're the only player who controls any creatures, you must give one of your own creatures -2/-2.

cards.originalText: When Hornet Harasser is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hunter of Eyeblights
cards.text:
When Hunter of Eyeblights enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you don't control.
{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with a counter on it.
cards.flavor: Snokk ran as fast as he could, but the sound of hooves grew ever louder in his ears.

rulings.text: The activated ability can target a creature with any kind of counter on it, not just a +1/+1 counter.

cards.originalText:
When Hunter of Eyeblights comes into play, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you don't control.
{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with a counter on it.

cards.name: Knucklebone Witch
cards.text: Whenever a Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Knucklebone Witch.
cards.flavor: Each bone honors its owner's best pranks.
cards.originalText: Whenever a Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from play, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Knucklebone Witch.

cards.name: Liliana Vess
cards.text:
+1: Target player discards a card.
−2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
−8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText:
+1: Target player discards a card.
-2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
-8: Put all creature cards in all graveyards into play under your control.

cards.name: Lys Alana Scarblade
cards.text: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.
cards.flavor: In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps.

rulings.text: The number of Elves you control is counted only as Lys Alana Scarblade's ability resolves. If Lys Alana Scarblade is still on the battlefield, it'll count itself.

cards.originalText: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.

cards.name: Mad Auntie
cards.text:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.
cards.flavor: One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.

rulings.text: The second ability can target any Goblin permanent except the Mad Auntie whose ability is being activated. It can target a different Mad Auntie.

cards.originalText:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.

cards.name: Makeshift Mannequin
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a mannequin counter on it. For as long as that creature has a mannequin counter on it, it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."
cards.flavor:
"This vulgar mimicry will end now."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play with a mannequin counter on it. As long as that creature has a mannequin counter on it, it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

cards.name: Marsh Flitter
cards.text:
Flying
When Marsh Flitter enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Marsh Flitter has base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Marsh Flitter comes into play, put two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens into play.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Marsh Flitter becomes 3/3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Moonglove Winnower
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

foreignNames.name: ツキノテブクロの選別者

cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature.)

cards.name: Mournwhelk
cards.text:
When Mournwhelk enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
Evoke {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
cards.flavor: It hoards Lorwyn's rare sorrows.

rulings.text: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
When Mournwhelk comes into play, target player discards two cards.
Evoke {3}{B} (You may play this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it comes into play.)

cards.name: Nameless Inversion
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.

rulings.text: If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.

cards.name: Nath's Buffoon
cards.text: Protection from Elves
cards.flavor: Smik learned the elvish dance quickly enough. The most difficult, yet most important step was to stay out of Nath's sight until called to perform.
cards.originalText: Protection from Elves

cards.name: Nectar Faerie
cards.text:
Flying
{B}, {T}: Target Faerie or Elf gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor:
"The unpredictable fae are just as likely to provide a blight as a boon."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

rulings.text: If you grant lifelink to a creature controlled by another player, that other player will gain life when the creature deals damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}, {T}: Target Faerie or Elf gains lifelink until end of turn. (Whenever it deals damage, its controller gains that much life.)

cards.name: Nettlevine Blight
cards.text:
Enchant creature or land
Enchanted permanent has "At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice this permanent and attach Nettlevine Blight to a creature or land you control."

rulings.text: Nettlevine Blight grants the triggered ability to the enchanted permanent, so "you" refers to that permanent's controller. The ability will trigger at the end of that player's turn, and that player chooses the new creature or land to attach Nettlevine Blight to. The player must choose a creature or land they control.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature or land
Enchanted permanent has "At the end of your turn, sacrifice this permanent and attach Nettlevine Blight to a creature or land you control."

cards.name: Nightshade Stinger
cards.text:
Flying
Nightshade Stinger can't block.
cards.flavor:

cards.text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If you control a Faerie, draw a card.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If you control a Faerie, draw a card.

cards.name: Profane Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Target player loses X life.
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.
• Up to X target creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

rulings.text: The value chosen for X applies to each X in the spell's effect. You pay {X} only once.

cards.originalText: Choose two Target player loses X life; or return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to play; or target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn; or up to X target creatures gain fear until end of turn.

cards.name: Prowess of the Fair
cards.text: Whenever another nontoken Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor: An elvish duel is a thing of beauty: the warriors' grace, the crash of steel, then the artful spray of blood.

rulings.text: If Prowess of the Fair and another nontoken Elf are put into your graveyard simultaneously (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), the other Elf will cause Prowess of the Fair's ability to trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever another nontoken Elf is put into your graveyard from play, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token into play.

cards.name: Quill-Slinger Boggart

cards.flavor:

—Calydd, kithkin farmer

cards.originalText: {2}{B}, Remove an Elf card in your graveyard from the game: Scarred Vinebreeder gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Flying

cards.name: Thorntooth Witch
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Treefolk spell, you may have target creature get +3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The crone's boughs creaked as she spoke. "You look peaked, little one. Come, sip from my warm brew. It'll have you blooming in no time."

cards.name: Thoughtseize
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Any dream is a robust harvest. Still, I prefer the timeworn dreams, heavy with import, that haunt the obsessive mind."

rulings.text: The loss of life is part of the spell's effect. It's not an additional cost. If Thoughtseize doesn't resolve, you won't lose life.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Warren Pilferers
cards.text: When Warren Pilferers enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If that card is a Goblin card, Warren Pilferers gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "What do they need all this stuff for? They're dead. We're alive. Simple enough."

rulings.text: The ability checks whether the targeted card is a Goblin when the ability resolves.
If the card is an illegla target as the ability resolves, the ability won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. Warren Pilferers won't gain haste.

cards.originalText: When Warren Pilferers comes into play, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If that card is a Goblin card, Warren Pilferers gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Weed Strangle
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Clash with an opponent. If you win, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. Clash with an opponent. If you win, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

(Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText: When Adder-Staff Boggart comes into play, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Adder-Staff Boggart. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

cards.name: Ashling the Pilgrim
cards.text: {1}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Ashling the Pilgrim. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, remove all +1/+1 counters from Ashling the Pilgrim, and it deals that much damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: "That much damage" refers to the number of +1/+1 counters removed from Ashling the Pilgrim. Since the counters are removed, it's likely that the damage will kill Ashling.
Counts resolutions, not activations. Any such abilities that are still on the stack won't count toward the total.

When the ability resolves, it counts the number of times that same ability from that this creature has already resolved that turn. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or the previous abilities when they resolved. A copy of this ability (created by Rings of Brighthearth, for example) will count toward the total. Abilities from other creatures with the same name don't count towards the total. Neither does an ability that's been countered.
You get the bonus only the third time the ability resolves. You won't get the bonus the fourth, fifth, sixth, or any subsequent times.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Ashling the Pilgrim. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, remove all +1/+1 counters from Ashling the Pilgrim, and it deals that much damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Ashling's Prerogative
cards.text:
As Ashling's Prerogative enters the battlefield, choose odd or even. (Zero is even.)
Each creature with converted mana cost of the chosen value has haste.
Each creature without converted mana cost of the chosen value enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: The "chosen value" is either "odd" or "even." So either creatures with odd converted mana costs enter the battlefield tapped and creatures with even converted mana costs have haste, or vice versa.
If a creature has X in its mana cost, that X is treated as 0 for the purposes of these effects. It doesn't matter what the value of X was while the creature was on the stack.

cards.originalText:
As Ashling's Prerogative comes into play, choose odd or even. (Zero is even.)
Each creature with converted mana cost of the chosen value has haste.
Each creature without converted mana cost of the chosen value comes into play tapped.

cards.flavor:

—Flamekin expression

cards.name: Hostility
cards.text:
Haste
If a spell you control would deal damage to an opponent, prevent that damage. Create a 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature token with haste for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Hostility is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

rulings.text: The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its new zone when its owner shuffles their library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

cards.originalText:
Haste
If a spell you control would deal damage to an opponent, prevent that damage. Put a 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature token with haste into play for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Hostility is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

rulings.text: Counts resolutions, not activations. Any such abilities that are still on the stack won't count toward the total.

When the ability resolves, it counts the number of times that same ability from that this creature has already resolved that turn. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or the previous abilities when they resolved. A copy of this ability (created by Rings of Brighthearth, for example) will count toward the total. Abilities from other creatures with the same name don't count towards the total. Neither does an ability that's been countered.
You get the bonus only the third time the ability resolves. You won't get the bonus the fourth, fifth, sixth, or any subsequent times.

cards.name: Lash Out
cards.text: Lash Out deals 3 damage to target creature. Clash with an opponent. If you win, Lash Out deals 3 damage to that creature's controller. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of their library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if their card had a higher converted mana cost.)
cards.originalText: Lash Out deals 3 damage to target creature. Clash with an opponent. If you win, Lash Out deals 3 damage to that creature's controller. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
